ModMetaData.name: [MLP] My Little RimPony - Medieval Overhaul Patches
ModMetaData.author: GeodesicDragon
ModMetaData.description: ABOUT This mod contains a series of patches which will make My Little RimPony (MLRP) compatible with Medieval Overhaul. WHAT'S BEEN CHANGED? * Daybreaker recipes now use coal instead of chemfuel. * Pawns in the Brony Community and Brony Xenotype scenarios start with plate armour instead of flak armour. * Sweetie Bot turrets require a million watts of power. * Poison joke joints can now be made at the workbench. * Plushie benches no longer require power. * Plushie benches are now built using iron bars and basic components. * Plushie benches are unlocked after researching tailoring instead of electricity. * Plushie benches can benefit from being near a tool rack. * Brony traders and villagers are now equipped with peasant gear. * Brony mercenaries have been converted into archers. * Melee mercenaries are equipped with plate armour and zweihanders. * Elite mercenaries and leader pawns are equipped with heavy armour and gunpowder weapons. * Quick research projects have been changed to the Medieval tech level. * Medium, hard and time-consuming research projects now require the advanced research bench instead of the high tech one. * Hard and time-consuming research projects no longer require a multi analyser. * Royalty DLC: Very hard research projects no longer require a multi analyser or techprints, but have been upgraded to the Spacer tech level. * Royalty DLC: Very time consuming research projects no longer require a multi analyser or techprints. * Mudbriar, Quibble Pants and Zephyr Breeze turrets now require a lot of power. * Factions added by MLRP have had their tech levels changed to Medieval. * The Stone Exchange no longer requires power. * The Super Speedy Cider Squeezy 6000 no longer requires power. * Nurse Redheart no longer requires power, but she will now spawn herbal medicine instead of industrial. * The Fabric Exchange no longer requires power, and is unlocked once tailoring is researched. * Vanilla Factions Expanded - Deserters: Requesting regular/critical intel now requires 50/100 herbal medicine. WHAT'S NEW? * Daybreaker has recipes to convert iron ingots into silver and back again. * Daybreaker has recipes to convert Medieval Overhaul's basic components into base RimWorld components and back again. * The Fabric Exchange has recipes to purchase linen, silk, daer leather, lindwurm scales, rox wool and tanning liquor. * NPC factions - regular and batpony - will now send scholar caravans. WHAT'S REMAINED THE SAME? * NPC faction pawns are still equipped with the relevant plushies. WHY IS THIS A SEPARATE MOD? Because I'd rather give people the choice of having these changes, rather than force them by putting these patches in with the main mod.
